definitions.explanation_en: A surname of Scottish origin, commonly found in English-speaking countries; often associated with notable individuals in sports, entertainment, or academia.
definitions.explanation_cn: 苏格兰姓氏，常见于英语国家，常与体育、娱乐或学术领域的知名人物相关联。
definitions.example_en: James Ewing was a pioneering pathologist who made significant contributions to cancer research.
definitions.example_cn: 詹姆斯·伊文是一位开创性的病理学家，对癌症研究做出了重大贡献。

definitions.explanation_en: A proper noun used to refer to specific places or entities named after individuals with the surname Ewing, such as Ewing Township or Ewing High School.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用作专有名词，指以姓氏 Ewing 命名的特定地点或机构，如伊文镇或伊文高中。
definitions.example_en: Ewing High School has won the state championship three times in the last decade.
definitions.example_cn: 伊文高中在过去十年中三次赢得州冠军。

comparison.analysis: “Ewing” 是一个专有姓氏，不具备普通名词的语义功能，不能像 “example” 或 “develop” 那样作为通用词汇使用。它仅用于指代人名、地名或机构名，属于专有名词范畴，因此在词典编纂中通常仅作为姓氏条目收录，而非普通词汇。
